moves.4. g3: An unnecessary opening for the bishop that costs time and creates weaknesses on the kingside. -0.20/27
moves.6. Bf4: Dreadful move that allows black to ruin White's pawn structure. -0.84/27
moves.9. Nce2: Nge2 was the obvious better choice. -1.25/27
moves.10... Bf5:
-0.83/27
Alternative variation: 10... Bg4 11. f3 Bd7 [is a little better.]
moves.11. Nf3:
-1.18/27

moves.13. O-O: Black erred here with 13. ... Ng3 which allows 14. Nxg3! Rxe3 15. Nxf5! Qxf4 16. Nxe3.
moves.13... Nc3:
Gives black a slight edge, and can lead to some exciting lines.

moves.15... Bxc2: Now 16. Qb5 Rae8 17. Rae1 Rxe1 18. Rxe1 Rxe1+ 19. Nxe1 Bb1 favors black somewhat.
